lisp_spec:
(task
  (name "findSecret")
  (signature ( (text str) ) str)
  (constraints
    (constraint "The input text will always contain the secret word at the very end.")
    (constraint "The secret word will be a single word.")
  )
  (goal
    (description "Extract the last word of the input text.")
    (rule "Split the input text into a list of words based on whitespace.")
    (rule "Return the last element of the resulting list.")
    (return "If the input text is empty, return an empty string.")
  )
)
generated_code:
from typing import List, Optional, Dict, Set, Any
import heapq
import collections

class Solution:
    def findSecret(self, text: str) -> str:
        """
        Extracts the last word of the input text.

        Args:
            text: The input text.

        Returns:
            The last word of the input text.
            If the input text is empty, return an empty string.
        """
        if not text:
            return ""
        words = text.split()
        return words[-1]
